channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Intelligence
channel.description: Latest threat intelligence threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: China's Cyber Arsenal Exposed: Knownsec Breach Leaks State Hacking Tools and Global Target Lists
item.description:
A monumental data breach at Knownsec, a prominent Chinese cybersecurity firm with close government ties, has resulted in the exposure of over 12,000 classified documents. The leak, which occurred in early November 2025, provides an unprecedented view into China's offensive cyber capabilities, reveal...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: EU Governments Under Siege: ENISA Reports Massive Surge in DDoS and Data Attacks
item.description:
A new threat landscape report from the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA) reveals that public administrations across the European Union are facing a dramatic increase in cyberattacks. DDoS attacks, largely driven by pro-Russia hacktivist groups like NoName057(16), account for 60% of all incidents, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft 'Whisper Leak' Attack Can Spy on Encrypted AI Chats
item.description:
Microsoft researchers have discovered a novel side-channel attack method named 'Whisper Leak' that undermines the privacy of encrypted AI chatbot conversations. By analyzing the size and timing of encrypted data packets from streaming Large Language Models (LLMs), a passive network observer can accu...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices
item.description:
The first day of Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 competition was a resounding success for security researchers, who earned a total of $522,500 for demonstrating 34 unique zero-day vulnerabilities. In a stunning display, every single one of the 17 scheduled attempts against popular SOHO devices—in...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: State-Backed Hacking Escalates: Russia Targets Ukraine, China Eyes Latin America
item.description:
A new report from ESET reveals a significant escalation in cyber operations by state-sponsored threat groups from Russia and China between April and September 2025. Russia-aligned groups, notably Sandworm, have accelerated destructive wiper malware attacks against Ukraine's critical infrastructure, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Software Supply Chain Attacks Skyrocket to Record High, Driven by Ransomware Gangs
item.description:
Software supply chain attacks reached an all-time high in October 2025, with 41 claimed incidents, according to a new report from Cyble. This figure is over 30% higher than the previous monthly record. Ransomware groups, particularly Qilin and Akira, are identified as the primary drivers of this tre...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical SQL Injection Flaw in Django Framework Puts Web Apps at Risk
item.description:
The Django project has released urgent security updates to patch a critical SQL injection vulnerability, CVE-2025-64459, rated 9.1 on the CVSS scale. The flaw affects Django versions 4.2, 5.1, 5.2, and the 6.0 beta. It allows an attacker to manipulate database queries by passing a specially crafted ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Zscaler: 239 Malicious Apps on Google Play Downloaded 42 Million Times
item.description:
A new report from Zscaler's ThreatLabz, published November 5, 2025, reveals a dramatic 67% year-over-year increase in Android malware. Researchers identified 239 malicious applications that successfully bypassed Google Play Store security, amassing a collective 42 million downloads before being remo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Malware, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Hijack Logistics Systems to Orchestrate Physical Cargo Heists
item.description:
A new and growing form of hybrid crime is targeting the supply chain, where cybercriminals infiltrate freight and logistics companies to facilitate physical cargo theft. According to recent reports, threat actors compromise carrier systems, often using legitimate Remote Monitoring and Management (RM...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

item.title: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Gladinet and CWP Flaws to KEV Catalog
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added two new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, confirming they are under active attack. The flaws include an information disclosure bug in Gladinet CentreStack/Triofox (CVE-2025-11371) and an OS...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence
